channel.title: I can't make my server public
channel.description:
Alright, I'll tell you what I did, step-by-step. For the record, this is my Internet link: Computer > Netgear Router > Cox Modem > Wall
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0001.jpg[/img] [b]Alright, I go on to PortForward.com, and I click on the Guides button.[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0002.jpg[/img] [b]Then, I click on the "Port Forwarding Guides for Router."[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0003.jpg[/img] [b]Of course, I then click my router model.[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0004.jpg[/img] [b]Then I choose what Moparscape should run on, 1st SMTP Server.[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0005.jpg[/img] [b]I put in the rest of my IP, and then I go ahead and read the guide.[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0006.jpg[/img] [b]I go into my IP, and then i click on the Port Forwarding/Triggering.[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0007.jpg[/img] [b]I type in the info it tells me to, except the IP, in which I type in the No-IP IP that I have. (This is not the problem, for I also tried it with my regular IP) Then I click apply.[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0008.jpg[/img] [b]Sure enough, it's saved.[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0009.jpg[/img] [b]I go into the Server Status page on Moparscape.org.[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0010.jpg[/img] [b]I scroll down to the "click here to register your server." And of course, I clicked on it.[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0011.jpg[/img] [b]I typed in all the information, and I put the No-IP IP in the IP field as it is in my Port Forwarding/Triggering page on my IP page. Then I click "Submit."[/b]
[IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0012.jpg[/img] [b]And this is what comes up... my server is online and everything. Below is proof:[/b] [IMG]http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa40/airforcepreporatoryclub/0013.jpg[/img]
[color=navy]My brother in my own house can't even log onto my server. WTF is going on (excuse my French texts...)?[/color

item.title: I can't make my server public
item.dc:creator: @Vanack Vanack
item.description:
@Vanack wrote:

Of which none of you stated, could be the most simple answer:
Were you running your run.bat/runserver.bat/or voule at the time of status page registration?

Even then, it may be as simple as your running your base on a 5555 port, and need to portforward, unblock from firewall, and re-register again, but this time with port 5555 instead of 43594.

Edit: Nevermind on this one, didn’t see the pic.

All I can think of that hasn’t been stated yet. Hope it helps!

-Vanack

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ddsowns ddsowns
item.description:
@ddsowns wrote:

open control panel, click network and internet connections, windows firewall add a port GeneralScape port 43594 and you put your start port as 25 and end port 25 change those to 43594, run register if it dont work then post here if it does pm me…

item.title: I can't make my server public
item.dc:creator: @Generalscape Generalscape
item.description:
@Generalscape wrote:


I go into the Server Status page on Moparscape.org.


I scroll down to the “click here to register your server.” And of course, I clicked on it.


I typed in all the information, and I put the No-IP IP in the IP field as it is in my Port Forwarding/Triggering page on my IP page. Then I click “Submit.”


And this is what comes up… my server is online and everything. Below is proof:

[color=navy]My brother in my own house can’t even log onto my server. WTF is going on (excuse my French texts…)?[/color

Read full topic
item.source: I can't make my server public

item.title: I can't make my server public
item.dc:creator: @Generalscape Generalscape
item.description:
@Generalscape wrote:

Alright, I’ll tell you what I did, step-by-step. For the record, this is my Internet link: Computer > Netgear Router > Cox Modem > Wall


Alright, I go on to PortForward.com, and I click on the Guides button.


Then, I click on the “Port Forwarding Guides for Router.”


Of course, I then click my router model.


Then I choose what Moparscape should run on, 1st SMTP Server.


I put in the rest of my IP, and then I go ahead and read the guide.


I go into my IP, and then i click on the Port Forwarding/Triggering.


I type in the info it tells me to, except the IP, in which I type in the No-IP IP that I have. (This is not the problem, for I also tried it with my regular IP) Then I click apply.


Sure enough, it’s saved.


I go into the Server Status page on Moparscape.org.


I scroll down to the “click here to register your server.” And of course, I clicked on it.


I typed in all the information, and I put the No-IP IP in the IP field as it is in my Port Forwarding/Triggering page on my IP page. Then I click “Submit.”


And this is what comes up… my server is online and everything. Below is proof:

[color=navy]My brother in my own house can’t even log onto my server. WTF is going on (excuse my French texts…)?[/color

Read full topic
item.source: I can't make my server public
